newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Live Picture Corp buys Israeli high-tech firm.
newsitem.headline: Live Picture Corp buys Israeli high-tech firm.

text.p: Live Picture Corp, a California-based digital imaging company, has acquired Israeli high-tech firm OLiVR Corp, an Israeli investment bank which acted as an adviser on the deal said on Wednesday.
A spokeswoman for the bank, HK Strategy & Finance, said the purchase price was not made public.

"Live Picture is the leader in providing imaging solutions over networks. OLiVR's technologies can enhance the user's experience by supplying immediately interactive images that can be streamed in real time," HK chief executive Robin Hacke said in a statement.

Live Picture's chairman John Sculley, former chief executive of Apple Computer, said during a visit to Israel last month that he intended to step up investment in the local high-tech industry through HK. Sculley is on the board of HK's Dutch-based parent company Catalyst.
In addition to the OLiVR acquisition, Sculley and Catalyst will invest in the financing of Israeli software company Zapa Digital Arts, HK said, without giving any figures.
Sculley will join Zapa's board of directors. Zapa provides visual communications solutions to Internet content providers, advertisers and marketers.
